meanings.definition: A large number or quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: The farmer had a rucks of apples to sell at the market.
meanings.sent2: She counted a rucks of colorful balloons at the party.
meanings.sent3: The rucks of toys in the playroom made the children squeal with joy.
meanings.sent4: The rucks of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The rucks of books on the shelf seemed never-ending.

meanings.definition: To gather or form into a ruck.
meanings.sent1: The students will rucks their desks together for group work.
meanings.sent2: Please rucks the scattered papers into a neat pile.
meanings.sent3: He tried to rucks all his thoughts into a coherent essay.
meanings.sent4: The wind can rucks the fallen leaves into a swirling dance.
meanings.sent5: She managed to rucks all the ingredients for the recipe on the kitchen counter.

meanings.sent1: The players formed a rucks on the field to gain possession of the ball.
meanings.sent2: The coach emphasized the importance of a strong rucks during the game.
meanings.sent3: The rucks in the rugby match looked like a tangled mess of bodies.
meanings.sent4: The rucks resembled a chaotic battle for control on the field.
meanings.sent5: The team's success relied on their ability to dominate the rucks in the game.
